subject: Re: [junit] assertArrayEquals on arrays of objects
msgSnippet: ... Production code may use something different for equality, eg an id field which makes sense for prod but that could produce false positives in test. ...
messageBody:
On Nov 17, 2012, at 9:30 PM, Robert Wenner <robert.wenner@...> wrote:

> On Sat, 17 Nov 2012 19:57:24 +0000 Colin Vipurs <zodiaczx6@...>
> wrote:
>
> > You'll need to override equals (and by definition hashCode) on the
> > objects in your array. I generally advise against doing this purely
> > for tests
>
> Isn't that a sign that production code may want to do this as well and
> that equality for these objects may make sense?
>

Production code may use something different for equality, eg an id field which makes sense for prod but that could produce false positives in test.
>
> > and instead look at implementing your own hamcrest matcher.
>
> How would a matcher check for equality without calling equals or
> hashCode?
>
>
Checking each individual field. I can provide examples of necessary.
> Robert
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
